K18 Some Inequalities Connected with Simplexes

PROBLEM:
Suppose p is a point of an n-dimensional simplex S, and for 0 ≤ i ≤ n−1, let Di denote the sum of the distances from p to the various i-dimensional faces of S. What relations among the numbers Di must persist for all p and S as described? In particular, if n = 3 (so that S is a tetrahedron) is it true that

i) D0 > √(8D2) (D. K. Kazarinoff) ?

ii) D0 > D1 (A. Shields) ?

iii) D1 > 2D2 (N. D. Kazarinoff and A. Shields) ?
